case_title: Raja Muhammad Hussain Khan, Deputy Superintendent of Police (Retired), Muzaffarabad vs Azad Jammu & Kashmir Government Through Its Chief Secretary
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Azad Jammu & Kashmir Government Through Its Chief Secretary

accussed_details.name: Raja Muhammad Hussain Khan
allegation: Violation of fundamental rights under Civil Servants Act, 1976

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged his retirement from service, alleging it was mala fide and aimed at promoting a junior officer. He also contested the legality of Section 12 of the Civil Servants Act, 1976, claiming it violated Islamic injunctions and fundamental rights.
investigation_summary: The appellant's service record was reviewed, including Annual Confidential Reports (ACRs) spanning decades. The Review Committee's assessment was found to be inconsistent with the guidelines issued by the government, leading to misrepresentation of the appellant's record.
judgment_summary: The court quashed the retirement order dated 27-12-1980 and the subsequent review order dated 20-2-1985, declaring them mala fide. The appellant was deemed to have been in service until his superannuation age on 26-5-1986 and entitled to all service benefits and pension.
legal_arguments: Retirement was mala fide and aimed at promoting a junior officer.
Violation of Section 12 of Civil Servants Act, 1976.
Failure to issue a show-cause notice before retirement.

legal_terms.Mala fide: Acting in bad faith or with dishonest intent.
legal_terms.Superannuation: Retirement upon reaching a certain age or service duration.

words_and_phrases.Annual Confidential Reports (ACRs): Performance evaluation reports for government officers.
words_and_phrases.Review Committee: A body tasked with assessing service records for retirement decisions.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the appellant's challenge to his premature retirement, alleging it was mala fide and aimed at promoting a junior officer. The court found inconsistencies in the Review Committee's assessment of the appellant's service record and declared the retirement orders unlawful. The appellant was reinstated until his superannuation age and awarded all service benefits.
